predicate.note: Frames file for 'enact' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

example.name: active
example.text: Saudi Arabia, for its part, has vowed *trace* to enact a copyright law compatible with international standards and to apply the law to computer software as well as to literary works, Mrs. Hills said.
example.arg: a copyright law compatible with international standards

example.name: passive
example.text: So both sides accepted the compromise, which would lead to the first lifting of the minimum wage since a four-year law was enacted *trace* in 1977, raising the wage to $3.35 an hour from $2.65.
example.arg: raising the wage to $3.35 an hour from $2.65

example.name: with redundant mention
example.text: The underlying stopgap bill is the second required by Congress this fall and, since the current fiscal year began Oct. 1, only the Energy and Interior departments are operating on permanent appropriations enacted *trace* into law.
